H0.text: Only coal was formed from the fossilized remains of tiny ocean organisms that contributed to fossil fuels.

H1.text: Only natural gas was formed from the fossilized remains of tiny ocean organisms, which were specific kinds of ancient organisms that make fossil fuels.

H2.text: Oil and coal were formed from the fossilized remains of tiny ocean organisms.

H3.text: Oil and natural gas are formed from fossilized remains of tiny ocean organisms.

A4.text: Petroleum is a fossil fuel derived from fossilized organic materials, such as zooplankton and algae.

A5.text: Petroleum is a fossil fuel formed over millions of years from anaerobic decay of organic materials from buried prehistoric organisms, particularly planktons and algae.
